DialogueText: The engine's been screaming all night. Something is wrong deep inside.
Choices: I'll investigate|What do you think is wrong?|Not my problem

DialogueText: Good. Take this key — it opens the lower maintenance hatch. Be careful down there.
Could be ice in the fuel lines or sabotage. Either way we freeze if it isn't fixed.
Choices: I'll handle it|Who would sabotage us?

DialogueText: Then we all freeze. Think about that.
We've had three fuel line breaches this week. That's not wear and tear — that's intent.
Choices: Who do you suspect?|I found evidence|Let me look into it

DialogueText: Could be tailies. Could be someone higher up. I need proof either way.
The children haven't eaten in two days. The engine section hoards while we starve.
Choices: I'll find rations|Why don't you go to them?|That's how it's always been

DialogueText: Bless you. There should be emergency stores near the engine room.
Three conduits are frozen solid. Pressure's dropping fast — we lose those we lose heat to half the train.
Choices: Where are they?|I'll clear them|How did they freeze?

DialogueText: Two in the lower deck and one topside near the exhaust vents. Take thermal paste — you'll need it.
Listen close kid. The Blockade ahead is not a wall. It is a slaughter line.
Choices: How do we get through?|Who commands it?|I can handle myself

DialogueText: Find shadows and timing. Never charge a Jackboot front line.
Commander Grey runs the line and enjoys making examples.
Confidence is loud. Survival is quiet. Remember that.
Every revolt writes a lesson in blood. Most are forgotten on purpose.
Choices: What lesson matters now?|What are you asking me to do?|How many revolts were there?

DialogueText: Carry this letter forward and do not open it. Some truths must arrive intact.
I need a path through the Blockade and eyes on Grey's command car.
More than one. Seven years of marks and names no one speaks.
If you want me beside you then keep up and do not hesitate.
Choices: Join me for the Blockade push|What do you need from me?|I work alone

DialogueText: Good. I hit hard and move first. You call targets and I break them.
Armor and medicine. Bring both and I am yours for the fight.
Then stay out of my lane when steel starts swinging.
The children can hear the gunfire now. They ask if tomorrow is safe.
Choices: I'll secure the nursery|Did someone take a child?|I cannot promise anything

DialogueText: Thank you. The nursery cabinet key is missing and supplies are low.
One child vanished in the night. No tracks. No witnesses. Only fear.
Then give me honesty and bring back medicine if you find any.
You are breathing so you are lucky. Sit still if you want treatment.
Choices: Trade medicine|Any news about missing children?|Patch me up

DialogueText: I can spare bandages and stimulants but not for free.
Two children gone this month. Both last seen near the service vents.
Hold still. Pain means you are still fighting.
You swing scrap like a tourist. Let me show you real balance.
Choices: Teach me crafting|Can you upgrade my weapon?|Why help Tailies?

DialogueText: Workbench first then heat then pressure. Rush any step and it snaps.
Bring scrap and I can harden that pipe into something worth carrying.
I was Third Class once. Hunger taught me where loyalty belongs.
Keep your voice down. Walls here report to men with badges.
Choices: What do you know about Grey?|Any safe route past patrols?|You seem paranoid

DialogueText: Grey favors his right side after old shrapnel. Force him to turn and he slows.
Use the maintenance ladder between Cars 7 and 8. Patrols miss the upper grate.
Paranoid people stay alive longer than brave fools.
You look tired friend. Kronole makes seconds stretch into opportunities.
Choices: Show me your stock|Got work besides dealing?|I do not touch that poison

DialogueText: Clean dose or cut dose. Price decides how steady your hands stay.
Bring me chemical compound from the still and I pay in rare tools.
Your choice. But everyone needs an edge before the Blockade.
Everything has a price. Secrets just cost more than bullets.
Choices: Let me see your goods|What secrets are you selling?|Why are you helping us?

DialogueText: Armor plates keys medicine. I sell survival and collect favors.
Grey rotates captains every dawn bell. Strike during the handoff.
Helping is not the word. I invest in likely outcomes.
Another Tail rat crawls to my gate. I was hoping for sport today.
Choices: Stand down Grey|I am ending this blockade|Keep talking while I get closer

DialogueText: This blockade stands until your section remembers obedience.
Then come prove it at my command car. I will carve the lesson myself.
Good. Rage makes you predictable and predictable things die first.
